name: String
description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

name: ID
description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

name: Int
description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: rollCallData
fields.description: This field is not returned from get_bill, but can be populated with a subsequent call to `get_roll_call`

fields.name: submissionCount
fields.description:
Returns the total number of question submissions in the candidate guide divided by the number of questions
in the candidate guide to get the number of intake submissions per candidate guide.

name: Float
description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

name: DateTime
description:
Implement the DateTime<Utc> scalar

The input/output is a string in RFC3339 format.

fields.name: racesByAddress
fields.description: Show races based on an anonymous user with an address

fields.name: racesByUserDistricts
fields.description: Show races relevant to the user based on their address

fields.name: candidateGuideSubmissionCountByRace
fields.description:
Each candidate guide embed is associated with a single race. This field returns the
the number of questions submitted by candidates in this race, divided by the number
of questions in a candidate guide

name: JSON
description: A scalar that can represent any JSON value.

name: NaiveDate
description:
ISO 8601 calendar date without timezone.
Format: %Y-%m-%d

# Examples

* `1994-11-13`
* `2000-02-24`

fields.name: districtType
fields.description: The type of district, used to determine which field is referenced for the district

fields.name: electionScope
fields.description: National, State, County, City, or District

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the office, e.g. "U.S. Senate"

fields.name: priority
fields.description: Used to determine order of offices in a list

fields.name: title
fields.description: What the person in office would be called, e.g. "Senator", "Governor"

description: Information about pagination in a connection

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: ratings
fields.description: Leverages Votesmart ratings data for the time being

fields.name: yearsInPublicOffice
fields.description:
Calculates the total years a politician has been in office using
the votesmart politicial experience array.  Does not take into account
objects where the politician is considered a 'candidate'

name: UUID
description:
A UUID is a unique 128-bit number, stored as 16 octets. UUIDs are parsed as
Strings within GraphQL. UUIDs are used to assign unique identifiers to
entities without requiring a central allocating authority.

# References

* [Wikipedia: Universally Unique Identifier](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier)
* [RFC4122: A Universally Unique IDentifier (UUID) URN Namespace](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122)
